Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Cargo \Car"go\, n.; pl. {Cargoes}. [Sp. cargo, carga, burden, load, from cargar to load, from cargar to load, charge, See {Charge}.] The lading or freight of a ship or other vessel; the goods, merchandise, or whatever is conveyed in a vessel or boat; load; freight. [1913 Webster]
Cargoes of food or clothing. --E. Everett. [1913 Webster]
Note: The term cargo, in law, is usually applied to goods only, and not to live animals or persons. --Burill. [1913 Webster]
cargo n : goods carried by a large vehicle [syn: {lading}, {freight}, {load}, {loading}, {payload}, {shipment}, {consignment}] [also: {cargoes} (pl)]
